quest.name: Untended Dreams
journal:
The royal seneschal seems deeply upset despite the jovial atmosphere.
※This quest is available for a limited time only.

The Songbirds continue to fill the streets with sweet melodies. Far removed from the glowing lights and cheers of the crowd before them, however, they spied an unexpected sight─a young girl sulking by her lonesome, seemingly lost. Knowing they cannot abandon their tight schedule of performances, the royal seneschal turns to you for help in locating this wayward soul.

※Please note that you will be unable to complete this quest after the seasonal event has ended. For details, please check the Lodestone.

You find a young girl near the Gate of Nald, sullen and withdrawn. She has lost a gift from her parents─a necklace and pair of earrings─and is too racked with worry to enjoy the day's festivities. Your offer to search for them in her stead is met with disbelief followed by heartfelt gratitude. She tells you she remembers where they were lost, but rather than explain in words, she draws you a picture of the location. With her artwork in hand, you exit the gate out into central Thanalan.

Finding a vista resembling the young girl's drawing was no easy task, but eventually a familiar view catches your eye. Indeed, you have found the correct locale, and an inspection of the area turns up a necklace and earrings. They are so old and worn, however, you question if they are what you were sent to find. The only thing left to do is return to Ul'dah and see if the jewelry you found is truly hers.

The young girl is overcome with joy at the sight of the jewelry. She is taken by the ardor with which you came to her aid, saying she at last knows what it means to be treated as a princess for a day. Before leaving to join in the Little Ladies' Day celebration, she makes a final request: deliver her necklace and earrings to a man named Tobyn at Crescent Cove.

Tobyn takes the jewelry in hand and quickly turns pale. After you explain what brought you out to Crescent Cove, he hesitantly concludes that the young girl you encountered was the spirit of his late aunt. She disappeared as a child on Little Ladies' Day, her family of the belief she was abducted and sold for some nefarious end. The reason for her ghostly visit to Ul'dah, he believes, is she never had the opportunity to enjoy Little Ladies' Day and be treated like a princess. But thanks to you, her unfinished business is complete. The royal seneschal will certainly be happy to hear the news.
The royal seneschal is shocked to hear of your paranormal encounter. Though he finds your story implausible, he takes solace in knowing the girl's spirit is finally at rest.
objectives: Search for the location in the lonesome lass's watercolor sketch to find her missing jewelry.
Deliver the tarnished necklace and faded earrings to the lonesome lass in Ul'dah.
Deliver the tarnished necklace and faded earrings to Tobyn in western Thanalan at Crescent Cove.
Report to the royal seneschal in Ul'dah on Emerald Avenue.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Should you choose to undertake this quest, you will receive no guidance from the journal or the duty list. You will need to read the text carefully and decipher the clues to determine your next course of action.

dialogue.name: BUTLER
dialogue.text: Excuse me, Forename. I hate to be a bother, but I have a favor to ask of you.

dialogue.name: BUTLER
dialogue.text: During their last performance, the girls said they spotted a girl all by her lonesome on the street. She seemed to be lost, perhaps looking for her parents. They're terribly concerned but they can't very well cancel their subsequent shows to look for her.

dialogue.name: BUTLER
dialogue.text: If you should happen to see this poor soul walking about, would you check on her and see that she's all right? When time permits, I too will do my part and help search for her.

dialogue.name: BUTLER
dialogue.text: The poor girl. I pray she's okay. The sooner we find her, the better.

dialogue.name: NAMELESSGIRL03085
dialogue.text: Hmmm. I wonder where they could be...

dialogue.name: NAMELESSGIRL03085
dialogue.text: Hm? What am I doing here?

dialogue.name: NAMELESSGIRL03085
dialogue.text: Well, I've... I've lost something quite dear to me.

dialogue.name: NAMELESSGIRL03085
dialogue.text: A necklace and pair of earrings my mother and father gave to me. They are my greatest treasures, and yet somehow I've managed to lose them.

dialogue.name: NAMELESSGIRL03085
dialogue.text: On today of all days. All I wanted to do was go and see the Songbirds. Everyone seems so excited that they're here, but how can I enjoy their performance knowing my jewelry is missing?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Never fear! I'll find them for you.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Do you remember where you may have lost them?

dialogue.name: NAMELESSGIRL03085
dialogue.text: You will? Truly?

dialogue.name: NAMELESSGIRL03085
dialogue.text: I'm fairly sure I remember where I lost them, but my parents said it's too dangerous to venture outside on my own.

dialogue.name: NAMELESSGIRL03085
dialogue.text: Yes, I'm pretty sure I remember, but my parents said it's too dangerous to venture outside on my own.

dialogue.name: NAMELESSGIRL03085
dialogue.text: Wait... You aren't thinking of going out there, are you?

dialogue.name: NAMELESSGIRL03085
dialogue.text: Thank you misssir, thank you!

dialogue.name: NAMELESSGIRL03085
dialogue.text: If you leave through this gate, they should be somewhere close by.

dialogue.name: NAMELESSGIRL03085
dialogue.text: Oh, I know! Let me draw you a picture.

dialogue.name: NAMELESSGIRL03085
dialogue.text: This is the last place I remember having them. I apologize if my drawing seems poor, but I hope it helps.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Use hints in the watercolor sketch to find the lonesome lass's missing jewelry.

dialogue.name: NAMELESSGIRL03085
dialogue.text: I'm fairly certain that's where I lost them. Please stay safe out there.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This doesn't appear to be what you're looking for.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You find a necklace, but it's badly tarnished and covered with rust.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You find a faded pair of earrings. The fasteners appear stiff from lack of use.

dialogue.name: NAMELESSGIRL03085
dialogue.text: Were you able to find them?

dialogue.name: NAMELESSGIRL03085
dialogue.text: My jewelry! I never thought I'd see them again.

dialogue.name: NAMELESSGIRL03085
dialogue.text: Thank you so much. I don't think I've ever been so happy as I am right now.

dialogue.name: NAMELESSGIRL03085
dialogue.text: You were so swift to grant my request and brave the wilds of Thanalan. It reminded me of the stories my mother told me, of the seneschals who would go on great adventures to fulfill the wishes of those they chose as their princess.

dialogue.name: NAMELESSGIRL03085
dialogue.text: Oh my! You would choose me?

dialogue.name: NAMELESSGIRL03085
dialogue.text:
Alright, then. Ahem...
Yea verily, thou art returned and brought unto me mine heart's desire. By your great deed, this shall be a momentous celebration, forsooth!

dialogue.name: NAMELESSGIRL03085
dialogue.text: Hahaha, forgive me if I seem strange. I've always dreamed of being waited on like a princess. I couldn't help but try to play the part.

dialogue.name: NAMELESSGIRL03085
dialogue.text: I do have one last request for you, though. Would you deliver this jewelry to a man named Tobyn at Crescent Cove?

dialogue.name: NAMELESSGIRL03085
dialogue.text:
Don't worry. When he sees them, he'll understand.
Now if you'll excuse me, I think the Songbirds will be performing soon.

dialogue.name: NAMELESSGIRL03085
dialogue.text: Thank you. My dear, sweet seneschal.

dialogue.name: TOBYN
dialogue.text: Need something, lasslad?

dialogue.name: TOBYN
dialogue.text: From a girl in Ul'dah!? What...what did she look like?

dialogue.name: TOBYN
dialogue.text: I'd call you a liar if not for these. I can hardly believe it.

dialogue.name: TOBYN
dialogue.text: The girl in white, this necklace, these earrings... I think you've met with my late aunt.

dialogue.name: TOBYN
dialogue.text: I was but a babe when she was taken away from us, so I only know what my parents told me. Wasn't until I was older that I finally understood the horror of it all.

dialogue.name: TOBYN
dialogue.text: The Little Ladies' Day celebration was like any other. The streets were lined with streamers, cherry blossoms far as the eye can see, and men were dressing up as seneschals looking to dote on the ladies of Ul'dah. But sadly, some of them weren't after a princess.

dialogue.name: TOBYN
dialogue.text: A group of men were luring girls into alleys, then whisking them off to gods know where to be sold to the highest bidder. Guess they thought my aunt would fetch a high price... And you're sure you saw her, this girl in white with my aunt's jewelry?

dialogue.name: TOBYN
dialogue.text: This may sound like utter nonsense, but... My folks said she wanted to take part in Little Ladies' Day more than anything in the world, to see what it was like being a princess for a day. Having never had the chance, maybe her spirit hadn't moved on yet.

dialogue.name: TOBYN
dialogue.text: These celebrations have been much safer ever since they began hiring royal seneschals, and the Songbirds put on a show no little lady would want to miss. Not even my aunt, it seems.

dialogue.name: TOBYN
dialogue.text: Thank you for delivering these to me. We never found her remains, but with these, I think now we can finally lay her spirit to rest.

dialogue.name: TOBYN
dialogue.text: Thank you again for delivering these. At last my aunt can be at peace.

dialogue.name: BUTLER
dialogue.text: Forename! I searched high and low, but could find nary a trace of a young girl matching the Songbirds' description. How did you fare?

dialogue.name: BUTLER
dialogue.text: A spirit, you say? Could such a thing really be possible?

dialogue.name: BUTLER
dialogue.text: I cannot say if she belonged to this world or the next, but thanks to you, we may take solace in knowing her dreams of Little Ladies' Day have been fulfilled.

dialogue.name: BUTLER
dialogue.text: I cannot thank you enough for dealing with this, but let's keep what happened between the two of us, shall we? If the girls ask, I will simply tell them she found her way home.
